poem:
In Turnberry, a Whisper of Ceasefire  

Amidst the pines and rolling greens,  
a president stands by the sea,  
hands gesturing towards a distant shore.  

In Gaza, silent hunger waits  
for manna from diplomatic skies,  
while words rise and fall like tides  
on sand, where peace walks a narrow line,  
its shadow cast by questions.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says he does not endorse Netanyahu’s claim there is no starvation in Gaza Donald Trump has said he believes there is a famine in Gaza and he has told Israel that “maybe they have to do it in a different way”. Speaking outside his hotel in Turnberry, South Ayrshire, on Monday, the US president said people in Gaza needed “to get food and safety right now” and that he wanted to get ceasefire talks". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Trump says he does not endorse Netanyahu’s claim there is no starvation in Gaza Donald Trump has said he believes there is a famine in Gaza and he has told Israel that “maybe they have to do it in a different way”. Speaking outside his hotel in Turnberry, South Ayrshire, on Monday, the US president said people in Gaza needed “to get food and safety right now” and that he wanted to get ceasefire talks
